pump.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a machine for forcing liquid or gas into or out of something
stomach pump (=for removing the contents of someone’s stomach)
pump.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a flat light shoe for dancing, exercise, sport etc
pump.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a woman’s plain shoe with no laces, buckles etc
pump.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make liquid or gas move in a particular direction, using a pump
pump.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The fire department is still pumping floodwater out of the cellars.
pump.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to bring a supply of water, oil etc to the surface from under the ground
pump.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: We were able to pump clean water from several of the wells.
He got a job pumping gas for the hotel guests.
pump.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to move very quickly in and out or up and down
pump.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: The furnace man’s job was to pump away furiously at the bellows.
pump.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: if a liquid pumps from somewhere, it comes out suddenly in small amounts
pump.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: to ask someone a lot of questions in order to get information from them
pump.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: I tried to pump him for information about their other contacts.
pump.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to put a lot of money into a business, plan etc
pump.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The government has already pumped a huge amount of money into the project.
